p.inline: Sport for development and peace: building a peaceful and better world through sport and the Olympic ideal

p.docTitle: Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 19 November 2025

docTitle.span: Building a peaceful and better world through sport and the Olympic ideal

container.name: Recalling
container.p: Recalling its resolution 78/10 of 21 November 2023, in which it decided to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session the sub-item entitled “Building a peaceful and better world through sport and the Olympic ideal”, and recalling also its prior decision to consider the sub-item every two years, in advance of the Summer and Winter Olympic Games,

container.name: Recalling also
container.p: Recalling also its resolution 48/11 of 25 October 1993, which, inter alia, revived the ancient Greek tradition of ekecheiria (“Olympic Truce”) calling for a truce during the Olympic Games to encourage a peaceful environment and ensure safe passage, access and participation for athletes and relevant persons at the Games, thereby mobilizing the youth of the world to the cause of peace,

container.name: Recalling further
container.p: Recalling further that the core concept of ekecheiria, historically, has been the cessation of hostilities from seven days before until seven days after the Olympic Games, which, according to the legendary oracle of Delphi, was to replace the cycle of conflict with a friendly athletic competition every four years,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p:
Recognizing the valuable contribution of sport in promoting education, sustainable development, peace, cooperation, solidarity, fairness, social inclusion and health at the local, regional and international levels, and noting that, as declared in the 2005 World Summit Outcome,
Resolution 60/1. sports can contribute to an atmosphere of tolerance and understanding among peoples and nations,

container.name: Recognizing also
container.p: Recognizing also the role that sports can play to prevent and counter terrorism and violent extremism conducive to terrorism, and its contributions to building resilience against radicalization to violence, recruitment and terrorist acts,

container.name: Welcoming
container.p: Welcoming the designation of 6 April as the International Day of Sport for Development and Peace,

container.name: Recalling
container.p:
Recalling the inclusion in the United Nations Millennium Declaration
Resolution 55/2. of an appeal for the observance of the Olympic Truce now and in the future and for support for the International Olympic Committee in its efforts to promote peace and human understanding through sport and the Olympic ideal,

container.name: Recalling also
container.p:
Recalling also that, in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development,
Resolution 70/1. sport is recognized as an important enabler of sustainable development, in particular for its growing contribution to the realization of development and peace in its promotion of tolerance and respect and the contributions it makes to the empowerment of women and of young people, individuals and communities as well as to health, education and social inclusion objectives,

container.name: Acknowledging
container.p: Acknowledging the valuable contribution that the appeal launched by the International Olympic Committee on 21 July 1992 for an Olympic Truce could make towards advancing the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations,

container.name: Recalling
container.p: Recalling its resolution 79/8 of 12 November 2024 on sport as an enabler of sustainable development in its three dimensions – economic, social and environmental – in which it called upon future hosts of the Olympic Games and the Paralympic Games and other Member States to include sport, as appropriate, in conflict prevention activities and to ensure the effective implementation of the Olympic Truce during the Games,

container.name: Noting
container.p: Noting that the XXV Olympic Winter Games will be held from 6 to 22 February 2026 and that the XIV Paralympic Winter Games will be held from 6 to 15 March 2026, across the host regions of the Milano-Cortina Games,

container.name: Noting also
container.p: Noting also that the vision of the Milano-Cortina 2026 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games acknowledges the role of sport in inspiring individuals and communities to uphold the Olympic values of excellence, friendship and respect, thereby contributing to broader global efforts to advance inclusion, sustainability and a culture of peace through sport,

container.name: Acknowledging
container.p: Acknowledging that the Milano-Cortina 2026 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games will be a unifying event and a meaningful opportunity to harness the power of sport to foster ongoing efforts for peace worldwide and to promote development, resilience, tolerance and understanding, accessibility and inclusion, and welcoming all the delegations of National Olympic and Paralympic Committees athletes and the Refugee Olympic and Paralympic Teams admitted by the International Olympic Committee and the International Paralympic Committee to participate in the Games,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p: Recognizing the importance of fostering strengthened international cooperation across editions of the Olympic and Paralympic Games, in support of the Olympic Truce and with a view to promoting collective efforts to uphold the universal value of sport as a driver for peaceful and inclusive societies, mutual understanding, solidarity and intercultural dialogue among nations,

container.name: Recalling
container.p: Recalling the importance of the meaningful engagement of local communities in the organization and implementation of the Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games, as a defining feature of Milano-Cortina 2026, in order to promote a strong sense of local ownership, community dialogue and identity, social integration, cohesion and the safeguarding of cultural heritage,

container.name: Noting with appreciation
container.p: Noting with appreciation the commitment of the Milano-Cortina 2026 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games to advancing all three dimensions of sustainable development and leaving a long-term legacy, including through measures aimed at reducing environmental impact, promoting resilient and sustainable infrastructure and ensuring lasting benefits for local populations and future generations,

container.name: Noting with appreciation also
container.p: Noting with appreciation also the continued efforts of the International Olympic Committee to advance gender equality in sport, and welcoming the fact that the Milano-Cortina 2026 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games will be the most gender-balanced in the history of the Winter Games, following the commitment to allocate an almost equal number of quota places to male and female athletes, thereby reinforcing the role of the Games in promoting equal opportunities,

container.name: Recalling
container.p:
Recalling article 31 of the Convention on the Rights of the Child,
United Nations, Treaty Series, vol. 1577, No. 27531. which outlines the right of the child to engage in play and recreational activities, and the outcome document of the twenty-seventh special session of the General Assembly on children, entitled “A world fit for children”,
Resolution S-27/2, annex. which stresses the promotion of physical, mental and emotional health through play and sports,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p: Recognizing the imperative need to engage women and girls in the practice of sport for development and peace, and welcoming activities that aim to foster and encourage initiatives in this regard at the global level,

container.name: Noting
container.p: Noting the successful conclusion of the Games of the XXXIII Olympiad and the XVII Paralympic Games, held in Paris from 26 July to 11 August 2024 and from 28 August to 8 September 2024, respectively, and welcoming the Games of the XXXIV Olympiad and the XVIII Paralympic Games, to be held in Los Angeles, United States of America, from 14 to 30 July and from 15 to 27 August 2028, respectively, the XXVI Olympic Winter Games and the XV Paralympic Winter Games, to be held across the French Alps from 1 to 17 February and from 1 to 10 March 2030, respectively, the Games of the XXXV Olympiad and the XIX Paralympic Games, to be held in Brisbane, Australia, from 23 July to 8 August and from 24 August to 5 September 2032, respectively, and the XXVII Olympic Winter Games and the XVI Paralympic Winter Games, to be held in Salt Lake City, United States of America, from 10 to 26 February and from 10 to 19 March 2034, respectively,

container.name: Acknowledging
container.p: Acknowledging the joint endeavours of the International Olympic Committee, the International Paralympic Committee and relevant United Nations entities in such fields as the promotion of human rights, human development, poverty alleviation, humanitarian assistance, health promotion, HIV and AIDS prevention, child and youth education, gender equality, peacebuilding and sustainable development,

container.name: Acknowledging also
container.p: Acknowledging also the importance of the Youth Olympic Games in inspiring youth through integrated sports, cultural and educational experiences, noting in this regard the successful conclusion of the Winter Youth Olympic Games held in Gangwon, Republic of Korea, in 2024, and welcoming the Summer Youth Olympic Games to be held in Dakar in 2026, as the first Olympic event organized on the African continent, and the Winter Youth Olympic Games to be held in Dolomiti Valtellina, Italy, in 2028,

container.name: Welcoming
container.p: Welcoming the proactive efforts of Milano-Cortina 2026 in conjunction with all Organizing Committees of upcoming Olympic Games, to implement new standards for delivering more sustainable Games in accordance with the International Olympic Committee reforms,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p:
Recognizing that the active involvement of persons with disabilities in sports and the Paralympic Games contributes to the full and equal realization of their human rights, as well as respect for their inherent dignity, recalling articles 1 and 30 of the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities,
United Nations, Treaty Series, vol. 2515, No. 44910. in which States Parties recognized the right of persons with disabilities, including those with long-term physical, mental, intellectual or sensory impairments, to take part on an equal basis with others in cultural life, and committed to take appropriate measures to encourage and promote the participation, to the fullest extent possible, of persons with disabilities in mainstream sporting activities at all levels, with a view to enabling persons with disabilities to participate on an equal basis with others in recreational, leisure and sporting activities, and noting in this regard the need for appropriate instruction, training and resources alongside accessibility of venues, and welcoming plans to stage integrated and inclusive Games,

container.name: Recognizing also
container.p: Recognizing also the role that the Paralympic movement plays in showcasing the achievements of athletes with disabilities to a global audience and in acting as a primary vehicle to promote positive perceptions and greater inclusion of persons with disabilities in sport and society,

container.name: Welcoming
container.p: Welcoming the significant impetus that the Olympic Games, the Paralympic Games and the Youth Olympic Games give to the volunteer movement around the world, acknowledging the contributions of volunteers to the success of the Games, and in this regard calling upon host countries to promote social inclusion without discrimination of any kind,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p: Recognizing the important role of supporters working alongside athletes and persons with disabilities to participate, organize and develop disability-specific sports,

container.name: Welcoming
container.p: Welcoming the commitment made by various States Members of the United Nations and other relevant stakeholders to developing national and international programmes that promote peace and conflict resolution, the Olympic and Paralympic values and the Olympic Truce ideals through sport and through culture, education, sustainable development and wider public engagement, and acknowledging the contribution of former hosts of the Olympic and Paralympic Games in this regard,

container.name: Recognizing
container.p: Recognizing the humanitarian opportunities presented by the Olympic Truce and by other initiatives supported by the United Nations to achieve the cessation of conflict,

container.name: Recalling
container.p: Recalling that, in its resolution 79/8, it supported the independence and autonomy of sport as well as the mission of the International Olympic Committee in leading the Olympic movement and of the International Paralympic Committee in leading the Paralympic movement, and recognized the unifying and conciliative nature of the Olympic Games and major international sport events and that such events are organized in the spirit of peace, mutual understanding, friendship, tolerance and inadmissibility of discrimination of any kind,

container.name: Acknowledging
container.p: Acknowledging all the fundamental principles of the Olympic Charter, including principle 6, which states that the enjoyment of the rights and freedoms set forth in the Olympic Charter shall be secured for all, without discrimination of any kind,

container.name: Noting with satisfaction
container.p: Noting with satisfaction that the United Nations flag will be flown at the Olympic stadium and in the Olympic and Paralympic villages of the XXV Olympic Winter Games and the XIV Paralympic Winter Games,

content.p: Urges Member States to observe the Olympic Truce individually and collectively, within the framework of the Charter of the United Nations, throughout the period from the seventh day before the start of the XXV Olympic Winter Games until the seventh day following the end of the XIV Paralympic Winter Games, to be held in Milano-Cortina in 2026, in particular, to ensure the safe passage, access and participation of athletes, officials and all other accredited persons taking part in the Olympic Winter Games and the Paralympic Winter Games, and to contribute through other appropriate measures to the safe organization of the Games;

Underlines the importance of cooperation among Member States to collectively implement the values of the Olympic Truce around the world, and emphasizes the important role of the International Olympic Committee, the International Paralympic Committee and the United Nations in this regard;

Welcomes the work of the International Olympic Committee and the International Paralympic Committee, as well as the International Olympic Truce Centre, in mobilizing national and international sports federations and organizations, National Olympic and Paralympic Committees and associations of these organizations to take concrete actions at the local, national, regional and international levels to promote and strengthen a culture of peace based on the spirit of the Olympic Truce, and invites those organizations and national committees to cooperate and share information and best practices, as appropriate;
Also welcomes the leadership of Olympic and Paralympic athletes in promoting peace and human understanding through sport and the Olympic ideal;

Calls upon all Member States to cooperate with the International Olympic Committee and the International Paralympic Committee in their efforts to use sport as a tool to promote peace, dialogue, tolerance and reconciliation in areas of conflict during and beyond the period of the Olympic and Paralympic Games;
Recognizes that sport and the Olympic and Paralympic Games can be used to promote human rights and strengthen universal respect for such rights, thus contributing to their full realization;

Welcomes the cooperation among Member States, the United Nations and the specialized agencies, funds and programmes, within their respective mandates, and the International Olympic Committee and the International Paralympic Committee, to maximize the potential of sport to make a meaningful and sustainable contribution to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals within the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, and encourages the Olympic and Paralympic movements to work closely with national and international sports organizations on the use of sport to this end;

Requests the Secretary-General and the President of the General Assembly to promote the observance of the Olympic Truce among Member States and support for human development initiatives through sport and to continue to cooperate effectively with the International Olympic Committee, the International Paralympic Committee and the sporting community in general in the realization of those objectives;

Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eighty-second session the sub-item entitled “Building a peaceful and better world through sport and the Olympic ideal” of the item entitled “Sport for development and peace” and to consider the sub-item before the Games of the XXXIV Olympiad and the XVIII Paralympic Games, to be held in Los Angeles in 2028.
